result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Shafer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact w/ Dollar General in Minong, WI

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J. Shafer

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Daniel J. Shafer appeared with Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Lawton offers a plea quesitonaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. 

16 CM 62--Def. pleas no contest, court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. 
Sentencing--1 year probation + costs
Condition: Not to go on premises of Dollar General in Minong, WI 

16 CM 81--Dismissed


16 TR 428-Def. plea no contest, court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty. $200.50
